answer:
The answer is: Woodrow Wilson.

Woodrow Wilson was the 28th president of the United States from 1913 to 1923. He was born in 1856 and died in 1924. He was a Democrat and a lawyer. Before he became president, he was a senator from New Jersey, a member of the New Jersey Supreme Court, and the vice president of the United States.
